intro: Pavetta birmahica, commonly known as the Birmahica pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often pubescent. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and feature five white to pale pink petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, black seeds.
